text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires the response to state that the governing law and scope of the dispute resolution clause will be a factor in the English court\u2019s discretion to grant the injunction. The candidate answer explicitly addresses this by discussing the arbitration clause's exclusivity (Section 2.1), the court's balancing test (Section 3), and specifically mentions that the court considers whether the arbitration clause gives the parties 'exclusive jurisdiction over the dispute' (Short Answer) and whether the clause expressly states that Singapore courts have exclusive jurisdiction for interim relief (Section 6, last scenario).
